translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to mental phenomena, the text of the Paṭṭhāna with the subcommentarial explanations
The Triad on the Wholesome, the Triad on the Manifest

original: Abyākato sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo naabyākatassa nasanidassanasappaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Tīṇi veditakaṁ kātabbaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na abyākatassa na sa nidassana sappaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi veditakam kātabba
translated: A non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon is a condition, as object condition, for a non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon. (Three triads are to be elaborated.)

original: Ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā tīṇi, upanissaye purejāte atthiyā avigate cha.
analyzed: ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā tīṇi upanissaye purejāte atthiyā avigate cha
translated: In the object, there are six; in the dominant, three; in the support, in the prenascence, in the presence, six.🔽With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, a wholesome mental phenomenon arises. (The first triad.)

original: Abyākataṁ anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo naanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo🔽naanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ anidassanasappaṭighaṁ
analyzed: abyākatam anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ  na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam anidassana sappaṭigha
translated: With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, an unwholesome mental phenomenon arises. (The second triad.)🔽With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, a non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon arises. (The third triad.)🔽With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, a wholesome mental phenomenon and a non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon arise. (The fourth triad.)

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanidassanasappaṭigho ca naakusalo naanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, an unwholesome mental phenomenon and a non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon arise. (The fifth triad.)🔽With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, a wholesome mental phenomenon and an unwholesome mental phenomenon arise. (The sixth triad.)🔽With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, a wholesome mental phenomenon and a non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon arise. (The seventh triad.)

With non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomena as condition, an unwholesome mental phenomenon and a non-cognisable, non-manifested, and non-inconstant mental phenomenon arise. (The eighth triad.)🔽With non-cognisable, non-manifested

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Kusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  kusalam a nidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na a nidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam a nidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With respect to cause there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to predominance there are three lines of reasoning. … With respect to absence of conflict there are three lines of reasoning.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ
translated: A wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on a wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition. A wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on an unwholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition. A wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on a neutral, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition.

original: naanidassanaappaṭigho ca naakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Akusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: na anidassana appaṭighaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  akusalam a nidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na a nidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: A wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on a wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition. A wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on an unwholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition. A wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on a neutral, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ
translated: An unwholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on an unwholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition. An unwholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on a wholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition. An unwholesome, non-visible, impingent consciousness arises in dependence on a neutral, non-visible, impingent consciousness as a condition by way of root cause condition.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo🔽naanidassanaappaṭigho ca naakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ  na anidassana appaṭighaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … with non-perceptible and impingeless states as condition, unskillful and non-perceptible and impingeless states come into play. … with non-perceptible and impingeless states as condition, skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless states come into play. … with non-perceptible and impingeless states as condition, both skillful and unskillful and non-perceptible and impingeless states come into play. … with non-perceptible and impingeless states as condition, neither-unskillful-nor-skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless states come into play.

original: Kusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighañca abyākataṁ anidassanaappaṭighañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalam a nidassana appaṭigham ca abyākatam a nidassana appaṭigham ca dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … with a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, an unskillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, an unskillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state and a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state and a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, both a skillful and an unskillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state come into play. … with a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, neither-unskillful-nor-skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless states come into play.🔽… with a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state and a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, an unskillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state and a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state and a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state as condition, a neutral and non-perceptible and impingeless state … with a skillful and non-perceptible and impingeless state and a neutral and non-perceptible and imp

original: Akusalaṁ anidassanaappaṭighañca abyākataṁ anidassanaappaṭighañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naanidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam a nidassana appaṭigham ca abyākatam a nidassana appaṭigham ca dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome, non-apprehendable, non-resistant and an indeterminate, non-apprehendable, non-resistant as condition, an unwholesome, non-apprehendable, non-resistant and an indeterminate, non-apprehendable, non-resistant idea arise through the relation of root-cause condition, etc. (The rest is condensed.)

original: Hetuyā pannarasa, adhipatiyā pannarasa …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pannarasa.
analyzed: hetuyā pannarasa adhipatiyā pannarasa pe aññamaññe tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pannarasa
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are fifteen. In the section on predominance, there are fifteen. … In the section on mutuality, there are three. … In the section on kamma result, there are three. … In the section on dissociation, there are fifteen.
